body: 'This game is an Indian version of "Cards against humanity" without any difference in the level of flamboyancy. Loved playing it with my gang.'

title: 'Humorous and easy to understand'
body: 'Good for medium and large groups. The Indian version is much better than the UK as the Sankaar version can be related to context easily and understood better.'

title: 'A must buy if you are a regular party host.'
body: 'The game is fun and everyone was rolling with laughter. We had so much fun that we played it again and again. Perfect for an only ladies party or a good gang of friends. There are a lot of non-veg shameless answers so it is not for a party where you at hosting your mothers or seniors.'

title: 'A Party Must-Have'
body: 'Amaaaaazing. The quotes are hilarious and crack everyone every single time whenever played.'

title: 'Good product. Need intellectual/witty crowd to play this.'
body: Good quality cards. Although its a good party game, but its not for 'Desi' people who do not have good command over english; or people who would not want to waste time reading and thinking over answers. Apt for people who play Taboo and similar games.

title: 'Must buy'
body: 'Is absolute value for money. I have played it multiple times and has been equally full all times.  The box is well packed and easy to carry'

title: 'Nice'
body: 'The BEST PARTY game with local crowd'

title: 'Best time pass game'
body: 'It is an excellent game to be played with friends!!'

title: 'Finally bought it'
body: 'The media could not be loaded. I have been thinking of buying this one for quite some time. Finally got it today. Played a little bit and some of the cards are hilarious. Will have to check out the rest later. Will pull it out for the party tomorrow.'

title: 'The best card game for a group'
body: It's an amazing game. Perfect for Indian scenarios and very relatable. It's fun for a game night

title: 'A FUNtastic buy'
body: 'Had amazing time playing this it is hilarious and fun.'

title: 'Great game!'
body: 'Amazing!'

title: 'BEST GAME EVER!!!'
body: Best Game Ever. I played this game earlier at my friend's house and had thoroughly enjoyed it. I ordered it just before the lockdown started. Since then i've played this game countless times with my family and we enjoy it. There were some awkward moments in the game when playing woth parents, but now we are past that awkwardness and have come closer as a family. Totally recommend it.  The packaging and card quality is brilliant. The cards maintain shape even after playing multiple times and the best part is, that it comes with a few blank cards, so you can send your own answers to the creators (or use them in the game)

title: 'Amazing Game!'
body: If you're looking for the perfect Indian alternative to Cards Against Humanity, this is it! The fact that it's customised to our sensibilities actually makes this game funnier. It's a party favourite!

title: 'Best party game for Indians'
body: 'Best party game you can buy in India where there is a severe lack of games for the adults. A very novel effort from the creators. Apart from the content being downright hilarious the cards themselves are made really well and is of great quality. It can seriously take a beating and will come out good. And that too for such a great price.'

title: 'Great product - Had a good time playing it'
body: 'Played with my friends over a party  had a great time . I would recommend it and play with a larger group of 6-8 friends over drinks'

title: 'Love it'
body: 'Totally recommend this for gatherings'

title: 'SUCH AN AMAZING GAME!! A MUST HOUSE PARTY GAME!!'
body: 'Played it at a friends house party instantly ordered it the very same moment.'

title: 'Amazing game'
body: Picked up this card game for a friend's party - lots of cards, relatable indian content, the box is sturdy and packaging is kickass! Over-all value for money, good gifting option.

title: 'Boring! Lacks humor and creativity. Below average product'
body: 'Disappointed! Below average product in terms of creativity. You tend to get bored even in large group after few rounds. Not at all witty. Avoid purchase.'

title: 'Not my cup of tea I guess!'
body: 'Way to vulgar content original one is so much better'

title: 'Fun'
body: 'Amazing and funny'

title: 'Funny AF'
body: 'An extremely hilarious party game. Can be given as a gift to friends as an alternative to routine card games.'

title: Not worthful. Don't buy
body: 'Ordinary game. Nothing special. Easy and boring question. It has nothing like adult game.'

title: 'Good content great game'
body: 'I Havent been able to play it yet. But I had sorted out the question and answer cards so far the content is nice its not crass and its a bit tamer than the content and language of social humour which was not my cup of tea. Havent played the game with my friends yet but will be doing so soon. Its going to be a hit I am sure.  The packaging was great and the card quality is also up to makr so no its aces in my books.  Price maybe could be a bit less but this categories of games with relevant content to us is scarce so I guess the price can be justified a bit.  Ultimately if you are looking for something a bit decent language-wise and content-wise but still entertaining would recommend to buy this game.'

title: 'Great for house parties!'
body: Got this as a gift for my friend's Christmas party and ended up playing it all through the night. The cards are super relevant, content is top notch. The packaging and card quality is good too. A little pricey in my opinion. Definitely buying another deck for myself - hope there are expansion packs!  I've been a fan of CAH over the years but the game never lasted long as we hardly got the references. Also played a game called social humour before but personally found it to be crass, sexist and honestly just cheap. Found CvS content tp be much more refined.

title: 'Great game'

title: 'Not as edgy as cards against humanity'
body: 'Cards actually felt pretty tame after a couple of rounds.'

title: 'amaze purchase'

title: 'An indigenous game.'
body: 'What an amazing card game. I played CAS with a bunch of friends and now we have a session every week.'

title: 'Do you like card games?'
body: 'This one is EPIC! If you like CAH you will love this even more! In terms of the Indian context this game has it bang on! Love love love this game!'

title: 'Want to have a fun party? Cards vs Sanskaar had got your back.'
body: 'Finally a relatable game! (On so many levels) Love the aesthetic of this product. The finish of the cards is of great quality. Really admire the work put into creating something that is so much fun to use and own! Definitely a good investment!'

title: 'So much fun'
body: 'Already addicted to this. Super fun.'

title: 'Is this game fun to play ?'
body: 'Hell YES! This game is the perfect PARTY GAME to play amongst adults who are comfortable with adult/edgy/explicit humor and understand that the fundamental point of this game is to be offensive and HILARIOUS. The rules are easy and as an Indian it feels amazing to see deep referential and culturally relevant content represented in a game. Relatable Representational and R rated!'
